intro: Jussiaea suffruticosa f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jussiaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its adaptability to wet conditions, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
